attributes.action: As a matter of urgency, ensure All new Opencast Mines in England have a 500 metre buffer zone for Public protection.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
We the undersigned, urge you Prime Minister, to ensure as a matter of urgency, that All proposed new Opencast Mines in England, receive a 500 metre Buffer zone for Public protection, as is the case with the rest of the United Kingdom.
Scotland was first to recognise the harmful effects of Opencast Mining, and requires a 500 metre Buffer zone around  any planned new Opencast mines, linked with a Health Impact assessment, in any planning application.
Just last year,Wales followed these directives for the protection of their people whose lives could be blighted by new planned Opencast Mines.
It is time Prime Minister, that WE, the English people had the same degree of protection from this awful form of environmental vandalism, as the rest of the UK is afforded.
At present, your Governments Communities and Local Governments Secretary of State, Mr John Denham, is considering a UK Coal plan to Opencast Mine in Telford,Shropshire.
We would urge you, to ensure that should this mine plan be approved , then a 500 metre Buffer zone be required for Public safety.
